title: 10-month-old baby killed in Marrero double shooting, JPSO says
content:
MARRERO, La. —
A 10-month-old baby was killed in a double shooting Saturday in Marrero.
The shooting was reported around 4:30 p.m. in the 2100 block of Caddy Drive, the Jefferson Parish Sheriff's Office said.
A spokesperson for the Sheriff's Office said the wounded 10-month-old boy was shot, Xyahir Davis, was taken to a hospital, where he was pronounced dead.
The other victim, a male in his late teens to early 20s, suffered multiple gunshot wounds. He was taken to a hospital, where he remains in serious condition.
Detectives said both victims were at the home with the baby's father and three other men when the shooting occurred. Witnesses told the Sheriff's Office that the gunman, who has not been identified, opened the door and began firing.
Officials have not released a description of the gunman. Anyone with information about the incident is asked to call Crimestoppers at 504-822-1111.
This is a developing story. Stay with WDSU.com for updates.
